My amendment said – hey FAA – follow the rules so we can move forward and stop wasting taxpayer dollars.  The amendment is also public and it’s been on the rules website since I filed it. Here’s the link if you want to read it. It’s number 314: https://t.co/woHIk8KT7b

I believe that government red tape and bureaucracy should not be able to hold up important infrastructure projects. POTUS agrees which is why he traveled to ATL last week to announce new rules to streamline the NEPA review process without compromising environmental protections.

The amendment was pretty simple. It would have required the FAA to utilize the review processes already laid out by NEPA instead of creating a non-standardized review process. The FAA is supposed to follow the NEPA review process but has worked outside of those guidelines.
At the request of the spaceport I offered an amendment to the transportation bill that was recently considered by the House. It was not made in order so it won't be moving forward.

If you saw the last story about the spaceport in the SMN you know it unfortunately required corrections even a front page correction. Due to previous reporting inaccuracies I would rather come straight to you instead of participating in another possibly questionable story.

It looks like the environmental reporter at the Savannah Morning News is writing another story about the spaceport in Camden County. I have been a very strong supporter of the spaceport since before I was elected to Congress and I will continue to support job creation in GA-01.
We must hold the CCP accountable. We also cannot continue to rely on foreign entities like China for anything especially when it comes to lifesaving medications. https://t.co/t5Kxj48DuE
